content.text: Use a ruler to measure the length \(l\) and the diameter \(d\) of the wooden rod you are using
Suggest a more accurate method for measuring the diameter of the rod
List any additional apparatus you would require and briefly describe how you would determine the diameter. You may draw a diagram if it helps to explain your answer
You are **not** asked to carry out this method
Measure the mass \(m\) of the wooden rod using the balance provided
Calculate a value \(\rho_{1}\) for the density of the wooden rod. Use your values from **(a)**(i) and **(b)** and the equation \(\rho_{1} = \frac{4m}{\pi d^{2} l}\) . Include a suitable unit
Method 2
Pour approximately \(150 \text{cm}^3\) of water into the measuring cylinder
Record the reading \(V_{1}\) of the water level in the measuring cylinder
Gently lower the wooden rod into the water so that it floats freely as shown in Fig. 1.2
Record the new reading \(V_{2}\) of the water level in the measuring cylinder
On Fig. 1.2, draw an arrow on the left-hand side showing the correct line of sight for reading the volume of water in the measuring cylinder

parts.label: (e)

content.text: Remove the rod from the measuring cylinder and lower the modelling clay into the water until it is completely submerged as shown in Fig. 1.3
Record the new reading \(V_{3}\) of the water level in the measuring cylinder

content.text: Remove the modelling clay from the measuring cylinder
Attach the rod to the modelling clay using the hook on the modelling clay and the loop of thread on the rod as shown in Fig. 1.4
Lower the modelling clay and rod into the water until the rod is completely submerged
Record the new reading \(V_{4}\) of the water level in the measuring cylinder

Use your values from **(d)** and **(e)** and the equation \(\rho_{2} = \frac{(V_{2} - V_{1})}{(V_{4} - V_{3})} \times k\) where \(k = 1.0g / cm^3\)

content.text: The temperature of the water falls as time passes. Use your results from (c) to describe the pattern of the rate of cooling of the water during the experiment
Justify your answer by reference to your results
Give an estimate of the probable final temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{F}}\) of the water if left to cool for many hours
A student in another school carries out a similar experiment
She starts with the hot water at a lower initial temperature
Suggest how her cooling rates are likely to compare with those calculated in (c)
Use your results to explain your answer

In this experiment, you will investigate the cooling of hot water in a beaker

content.text: Switch on
Connect the crocodile clip to lengths \(l = 70.0 \text{cm}, 60.0 \text{cm}, 50.0 \text{cm}, 40.0 \text{cm}\) and \(30.0 \text{cm}\) of the resistance wire in turn
For each length \(l\) measure the current \(I\) in the circuit. Record your readings in Table 3.1.
Switch off
Calculate, and record in Table 3.1, the value of \(\frac{1}{I}\) for each length \(l\) of the wire
Plot a graph of \(l / \text{cm}\) (y-axis) against \(\frac{1}{I} /\frac{1}{\text{A}}\) (x-axis). You do **not** need to start your axes at the origin (0,0)
Determine the gradient \(G\) of the graph. Show clearly on the graph how you obtained the necessary information
Calculate the electromotive force (e.m.f.) \(E\) of the power supply. Use your value of \(R_0\) from (a) and the equation \(E = \frac{G \times R_0}{k}\), where \(k = 100 \text{cm}\)

The ammeter in this circuit has a small resistance which affects the current. The effect of this resistance on the measured current \(I\) will be different for each measured length \(l\) of the resistance wire
State and explain which length \(l\) will be most affected by the resistance of the ammeter
statement
explanation
In this experiment, you will investigate a power supply
The circuit has been set up for you
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 3.1
A student investigates a wind turbine, which is an electrical generator driven by a propeller blade
Plan an experiment which will enable him to investigate how the current in a resistor connected across the terminals of the turbine varies with the speed of the air flow through the turbine
You are **not** required to carry out the experiment
The apparatus available includes:
a model wind turbine as shown in Fig. 4.1
an electric fan to provide the moving air to turn the turbine
a device for measuring air speed
In your plan, you should:
list any additional apparatus needed
complete the wind turbine circuit diagram on Fig. 4.1
state the key variables to be kept constant
explain briefly how to carry out the experiment, including how the speed of the air flow is to be changed
explain how to use the readings to reach a conclusion
